intro: Bocconia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited bocconia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-white in color, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Bocconia microcarpa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
